name: GooglePlayRelease
description: Release an app to the Google Play Store
author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: serviceEndpoint
inputs.label: Service connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Google Play service connection that is configured with your account credentials.

inputs.name: serviceAccountKey
inputs.label: JSON key path
inputs.helpMarkDown: The JSON file provided by Google Play that includes the service account's identity you wish to publish your APK under.

inputs.name: apkFile
inputs.label: APK path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the APK file you want to publish to the specified track. Wildcards can be used. For example, _\*\*/\*.apk_ to match the first APK file, in any directory.

inputs.name: shouldPickObbFile
inputs.label: Upload Obb
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this option to pick obb file for the apk. If present in the parent directory, it will pick the first file with .obb extension, else it will pick from apk directory with expected format as main.<version code>.<package name>.obb

inputs.name: track
inputs.label: Track
inputs.helpMarkDown: Track you want to publish the APK to.

inputs.name: changeUpdatePriority
inputs.label: Set in-app update priority
inputs.helpMarkDown: Change the in-app update priority value.

inputs.name: updatePriority
inputs.label: In-app Update Priority
inputs.helpMarkDown: Set a custom in-app update priority value to help keep your app up-to-date on your usersâ€™ devices. To determine priority, Google Play uses an integer value between 0 and 5, with 0 being the default, and 5 being the highest priority. Priority can only be set when rolling out a new release, and cannot be changed later.

inputs.name: rolloutToUserFraction
inputs.label: Roll out release
inputs.helpMarkDown: Roll out the release to a percentage of users.

inputs.name: userFraction
inputs.label: Rollout fraction
inputs.helpMarkDown: The percentage of users the specified APK will be released to for the specified 'Track'. It can be increased later with the 'Google Play - Increase Rollout' task.

inputs.name: shouldAttachMetadata
inputs.label: Update metadata
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this option to update the metadata on your app release.

inputs.name: changeLogFile
inputs.label: Release notes (file)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the file specifying the release notes (change log) for the APK you are publishing.

inputs.name: languageCode
inputs.label: Language code
inputs.helpMarkDown: An IETF language tag identifying the language of the release notes as specified in the BCP-47 document. Default value is _en-US_

inputs.name: metadataRootPath
inputs.label: Metadata root directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: The path to the metadata folder with the fastlane metadata structure.

inputs.name: updateStoreListing
inputs.label: Update only store listing
inputs.helpMarkDown: By default, the task will update the specified track and selected APK file(s) will be assigned to the related track. By selecting this option you can update only store listing.

inputs.name: shouldUploadApks
inputs.label: Update APK(s)
inputs.helpMarkDown: By default, the task will update the specified binary APK file(s) on your app release. By unselecting this option you can update metadata keeping the APKs untouched.

inputs.name: shouldUploadMappingFile
inputs.label: Upload deobfuscation file (mapping.txt)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this option to attach your proguard mapping.txt file to the primary APK.

inputs.name: mappingFilePath
inputs.label: Deobfuscation path
inputs.helpMarkDown: The path to the proguard mapping.txt file to upload.

inputs.name: additionalApks
inputs.label: Additional APK path(s)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Paths to additional APK files you want to publish to the specified track (e.g. an x86 build). Wildcards can be used. For example, _\*\*/\*.apk_ to match all APK files, in any directory.

inputs.name: shouldPickObbFileForAdditonalApks
inputs.label: Upload Obbs
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this option to pick obb file for the apk. If present in the parent directory, it will pick the first file with .obb extension, else it will pick from apk directory with expected format as main.<version code>.<package name>.obb

inputs.name: versionCodeFilterType
inputs.label: Replace version codes
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify version codes to replace in the selected track with the new APKs: all, the comma separated list, or a regular expression pattern.

inputs.name: replaceList
inputs.label: Version code list
inputs.helpMarkDown: The comma separated list of APK version codes to be removed from the track with this deployment.

inputs.name: replaceExpression
inputs.label: Version code pattern
inputs.helpMarkDown: The regular expression pattern to select a list of APK version codes to be removed from the track with this deployment, e.g. _.\*12?(3|4)?5_
